lexUnit.name: attest.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: provide or serve as clear evidence of.

sentence.text: Despite such problems , a growing body of scientific evidence attests that yoga can influence nearly all the Physiological systems of the human organism , and has therapeutic effects on a wide range of disorders .

Their recognition attests the presence of several wealthy individuals disposed to live in the town itself , while yet others occupied nearby villas , including the winged-corridor complex in the rural-urban fringe to the east , and the villa to the west at Bishopstone .
Episcopal registers amply attest the development of this system .
Here , there are indications between mosaics of some continuity in technique , attesting the presence of an individual style .
That it was once much greater is attested by the many traces of former lazy-beds to be seen on the grazing land .
The perfection of this design is attested by the fact that species belonging to quite different families of fish have adopted it and thus bear a strong resemblance to one another .
His status in the merchant community is attested by his becoming an alderman in 1690 and , following his father , serving as mayor of King 's Lynn in 1692 and 1703 .
The importance of the blacksmith is further attested by three ironwork hoards at Dorchester-on-Thames , Great Chesterford and Sandy .
The market dependence of the latter group is attested by their proclivity for food rioting , as is that of miners , while urban expansion obviously increased the role and reach of the market .

That this must be the explanation for Kammerer 's disturbing results is attested to by the discovery of a wild midwife toad with rudimentary nuptial pads as much as two years before Kammerer took his own life .

It has been observed that in Berkshire , topographical names , particularly those referring to water are the most common Old English names in areas where early Anglo-Saxon settlement has been attested archaeologically .
Its administrative importance is certainly attested for the sixth century , and it probably continued , although evidence is almost non-existent for the later period .
The story may be true since instances of such zeal are well attested for Christian antiquity .
However , as is widely attested , irrespective of minimum wages , women do tend to earn less than men in the First as well as the Third World .
Though the figures may well be inaccurate , they attest the contemporary impression that even local forces could be very large , at least in time of emergency .
All this suggests contraction in this sector , although coins from the house of Theodosius attest casual occupation until the end of the century at least .

The dangers of disregarding , by ignorance or design , the essentially conditional nature of abstract models and of making data fit into preconceived categories are well attested in the theoretical domain .
The often passionate commitment of small children to the protection of distant forests attests to the widespread awareness of the global scope of this issue .
The system 's 10K-450K temperature range attests to its flexibility for cooling samples in a wide range of applications .

The proliferation of disputes over scarce water resources , particularly between states bordering the Nile , Euphrates and Jordan rivers , attests to the impact of resource depletion , as does the relationship between deforestation and desertification .
